accounts.summary: Jesus is crucified under Pilate, mocked, and dies with a loud cry as the temple curtain is torn.
accounts.notes: Strong emphasis on suffering and abandonment; centurion confesses Jesus as Son of God.

accounts.summary: Jesus is crucified, mocked, cries out in despair, and dies. Accompanied by an earthquake and the raising of saints.
accounts.notes: Follows Mark closely but adds apocalyptic signs (earthquake, raised saints) and guards at the tomb.

accounts.summary: Jesus is crucified, asks forgiveness for his executioners, speaks with the penitent thief, and commits his spirit to the Father.
accounts.notes: Highlights Jesus' innocence, compassion, and control; includes 'Father, forgive them' and the promise of Paradise to the thief.

accounts.summary: Jesus is crucified as 'King of the Jews,' cares for his mother, and dies after declaring 'It is finished.'
accounts.notes: Portrays Jesus as sovereign and in control; details of piercing and fulfillment of Scripture.
